userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Preferred citation: Edward Graham Correspondence, WLU Coll. 0031, Special Collections, Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Leyburn, VA.
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections staff to verify the appropriate format.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Blue sheet prepared by Betty Kondayan (10/14/2002)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edward Graham was professor (1813) at Washington College, he also presided over the college library, 1813-1839; his brother was William Graham, a steward and tutor during the later years of Liberty Hall Academy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter [183-] from 'a citizen' [Edward Graham] extolling the military worth of students. In addition, a document, dated July 5, 1822, which is signed by John Quincy Adams, stipulating what government documents Washington College will receive.
